messages.content: Change Britain's future by voting for Frank Harasiwka on June 8th.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We need new and additional investment in health and care services at every level. The Lib Dems' plan includes the funds it needs.
Local schools are under threat from budget cuts. The Lib Dems would reverse all cuts to our education budgets.

Tories have admitted that post Brexit there will be no reduction in migration, no access to the single market and no extra £350m a week for NHS. Many people feel that they should have a vote on the final deal.

issues.education: Opposing school cuts. Schools in Bolton are set to lose £19 million from their budgets, putting over 500 teaching posts at risk.
issues.health: Standing up for the NHS. Investing an additional £6 billion across the UK to ensure massive investment for health and social care, right here in Bolton.

community.content: Locally, areas like Farnworth and Kearsley have been deprived of funding whilst Cliff Morris and his local colleagues have happily given £300,000 to wealthy solicitors in Bolton Town Centre.

leaflet.personalStatement: Many people in Bolton South East have told me of their despair with the Tory Government about the lack of funding for the NHS, education and housing. Rather than challenging the Government on these issues, Jeremy Corbyn's Labour MPs have chosen to fight amongst themselves. My main focus for this election is the protection of the NHS, where my wife has worked as a midwife and nurse for over 35 years. By supporting a 1p increase in tax I am being straight with you that only by raising more tax are we able to fund the NHS properly. Is the NHS worth £3 a week extra in tax? I think it is.

images.caption: Frank Harasiwka for genuine change in Bolton South East. £31 million more for the NHS and Social Care in Bolton, £770 more for pensioners by protecting the triple-lock, Reversing cuts of £19 million to schools throughout Bolton.
